title: Impressive! text: I have thick loose wavy hair and I had damanged hair from the years of hair straighting and hard water. No conditioner or leave in treatments have been able to help restore my hair. It was at the point where I couldn‚Äôt even run my fingers through it without kinks. My hair felt like straw and always looked dry and frizzy no matter what I did to it. After using this, my hair feels amazing. Smooth and has a nice slip to it. No more kinks. I think the best part is that this doesn‚Äôt wash off. I‚Äôm not sure how many showers I have to go through before I have to reapply, but I can tell one tube will last me for a while. After you shower, grab enough of this to cover a thin layer in your hair and then blow dry. It will feel sticky and tacky but once your hair is completely dried, it will just feel like smooth silky hair. If you feel you put too much in one area, put some water in that area to thin the cream and then blow dry again.

I really wish I found out about this product before I chopped off my hair. But seriously, wow! Amazing product. Instant and permanent! KBeauty has done it again.

title: Easy to mix, works as advertised. text: Good variety of scents and benefits. Would make great gifts or stocking stuffers. I do like that some of the same benefits can be found in multiple masks so you can reap the benefits over time instead of just randomly. It would be nice to have it by skin type individually too though.

I like the concept of powder since it doesn‚Äôt dry out and it‚Äôll keep longer. It states to use 30 ml of water which if you don‚Äôt have anything to measure that, the standard medicine cups are usually marked for that if you have those in your cabinet. I did have to use a tiny bit more as it became a paste initially.

There is a lot of product in each tube. Honestly one could probably get away with using half at a time as the whole tube was enough for me to do down my neck as well and I put it on VERY thick. It does dry down though. If it‚Äôs too thin it is harder to peel. My skin felt plumped and moisturized. The scent is a bit artificial but more like a pleasant candle than something sickly sweet. Definitely think it‚Äôs a good value for the price.

title: Good slip, highly recommended text: I was given the opportunity to review Keeva's tee tree oil shampoo and fell in love with it right after first use. I wasn't around to when they were selecting reviewers for their conditioner but now that it's available for purchase I'm glade to say I've bought it for full sale price being 20 USD. Like it's shampoo counterpart the bottle is 28oz total.

Texture: White and creamy
Scent: Pleasant and definitely not reeking of tea tree oil like it's shampoo sister
Slip: Slip is a product's ability to allow one to detangle hair effectively and not need to use too much product to do so. For the amount I used which is pretty standard across the board with all conditioners I've tried, this conditioner is rated at 5/5 for slip
Moisture: Next to none but that isn't a real issue due to most of the oils being found in Keeva's tea tree oil shampoo
Standout Ingredients: hydrolyzed keratin ( protein ), argania spinose ( Moroccan argon oil ), cetearyl alchol ( fatty alcohol )

Cons:
Cocos nucifera ( Coconut Oil ) isn't listed as an ingredient, however it is featured as an ingredient on the front of the bottle.
Melaleuca alternifolia ( Tea Tree Oil ) isn't listed as an ingredient either.
Both of these oils is on the front of the bottle being featured however, the product doesn't list the oils as ingredients.

Overall, I believe this to be a quality conditioner even better than some brands found in salons. Price of the bottle is reasonable for the quantity received. This conditioner does provide one with good slip and it doesn't leave hair feeling heavy or weighted down after rinsing. I feel that when used with it's sister shampoo, you'll benefit from this conditioner most .

title: Lashes are a great length, but....... text: I ordered this set for the lashes since I already have some liner. I am very glad I do have the liner because the one that comes with this set is crap. I made sure my eyes were clean and dry. I read the directions on the back of the package...
shake the liner 10 times (I made sure I shook it more than that), apply a thick layer and let dry a few seconds (it took longer than that) apply another thick coat then get the lash and apply it to the liner area. gently press down.
Very simple right? NOPE. The edges kept lifting up and the lash fell off after a couple of blinks. OK I thought, maybe my liner wasn't thick enough, so I applied another really good coat and then tried the lash again....Same results. I then washed my eye again and tried with my other liner and the lash stayed on like it should.
I like the lashes very much. All three pair are a natural length (IF you use mascara), and vary in looks. If you get these, make sure you have another liner available or plan to purchase one.

title: Great All Around Trimmer
text: Was looking online for a solid trimmer for detailing my goatee, and after much research settled on the Norelco T980 Turbo Vac Trimmer. As far a detailed trimmer I find it very easy to use as it allows precision trimming lengths and the detail blade makes fine detailing a breeze. It even does a better job shaving my head than my Oster Turbo 111 electric razor. It's build quality is solid and the battery charge lasts a long time. I would highly recommend this product.

title: Health and product review text: Let me start off with saying I do not use makeup daily, more like once a week if that but I still recommend the same advice even for daily makeup wearers: change this out either once every week or every two weeks. This is not because the quality is poor, this is for health reasons. All sponges collect bacteria.

Now on to the product review, this showed up really fast with prime and comes with two cases, one to carry a single one and the second to store the rest. Having them as two different colors helps a lot and makes it fun to change. They are soft but not too porous, the makeup will sink in a bit but not too much. These are better suited for applying makeup but not blending them together. I recommend lightly (or roughly if you don‚Äôt care) patting your face rather than dragging or rubbing it on, you‚Äôll just end up taking the makeup off your skin.

title: Feels Lightweight For My Dry Skin, Better For Evening As Strong Lavender Scent & Retinyl Palmitate text: This Kneipp lavender lotion is thick, but it‚Äôs not a heavy or greasy lotion. This probably provides moderate hydration for normal skin, but for me it feels quite lightweight. I think it‚Äôs a nice cream, but I prefer a richer lotion or cream that comforts my dry skin more and provides longer lasting hydration. When I‚Äôve applied this after an evening shower, my skin feels reasonably moisturized for a few hours but it‚Äôs not enough moisture to last all night so I need to reapply before bed. This seems best for those who don‚Äôt need heavy hydration and enjoy a lavender scent.

This lotion does have a moderately strong lavender scent that even lingers on my hands after washing. It smells nice and doesn‚Äôt bother me, but it may bother those sensitive to fragrance as this is just in the range of what I can tolerate as strong lavender has been a headache trigger for me. This lotion has retinyl palmitate, which is especially risky mixed with sun exposure. This lotion seems best for evening use given that lavender can be relaxing and retinyl palmitate doesn‚Äôt mix well with sun. Like it. 4 stars.

title: Super Convienent! text: I wasn't expecting to love these nearly as much as I do. Thick, large and easily removes all ten nails worth of polish without making my fingers feel overly dried out like using my regular polish remover.

These work fast, I don't know what makes the formula 'advanced' but the process is quick and clean.
The smell isn't overwhelming, just the basic remover smell. Works great, travels even better. I'll be keeping these on hand!

title: Very Small, Great for Travel text: These are very small towelettes that come in a small sealed packet. It's perfect for travel given its small size but I needed at least 2 towelettes to wipe down my entire face. That means it will be used up very quickly so the value is average. The towelettes aren't particularly strong either - I tore one just pulling it out of the package. There is also no alcohol in the formula so it's best used for wiping your face rather than disinfecting your hands - for that you're better off using something with alcohol in it to kill the germs. As a result, this bundle of towelettes has limited usefulness - it's good for a light face cleaning or to finish the job left by a facial cleanser.

I like the fact that it's paraben free and has no scent to irritate my allergies. Overall it's good but not great.

title: This Mask Is Awesome
text: So I've tried A LOT of sheet masks and NONE of them worked for me. They either broke me out, or didn't secure on my face right, or they just didn't do anything for my face at all. This is the first sheet mask where I actually felt my face responding to it in a good way. It smelled just like citrus without it being too overpowering, nor was the tingly sensation, it told me that it was working! I also liked how this wasn't dripping with ampoule, it had the perfect amount to soak the face without it making a mess on your countertop or where the stuff would be rolling down your face and to your chest or creeping towards your eyes. So that in turn made wearing this more relaxing and not so irritating and awkward like most if not all the other sheet masks I tried. I almost didn't want to remove it, that's how much I enjoyed and loved it! I couldn't believe how baby soft smooth my skin was after using it. It wasn't a life-changer or game-changer for my hyperpigmentation, but it's unrealistic and next to impossible for any product to do that after only one use. My skin loved this though, I can tell that this is perfect for my skin type (combination/oily acne prone skin). I thought I'd swore off sheet masks. Granted, I'm still not blown away by sheet masks in general, this mask hasn't made me a fan of them, BUT...I'd totally buy this again. It was awesome.

title: Stunning, Beautiful, Adjustable Wig For Costume Or Play
text: Kids Size Long Wavy Halloween Wig (for 4-12 years old) is a stunning, beautiful wig for costume or play. This wig immediately reminded me of Sleeping Beauty‚Äôs gorgeous long curls and color. These curls are absolutely divine in both the ends and bangs. Truly a magnificent princess wig. There are elastic bands at the back of the wig to make it fit any size head. It will fit a small to large head with these clip elastic adjustments. Should the wig be too large for a really young, small child, you can always stitch it closer in the back on the inside. A couple stitches has made any wig tighter, and you can always remove the stitches for a larger child. However, I found the elastic straps hook really tight or looser, so I didn‚Äôt have a need for that. The curls are layered for a stunning effect. I love the bangs having those same large curls for a true princess look. The color is a light and gold blonde mix- just gorgeous. This is one beautiful wig for play or costume. 5 STARS.

title: weightless, non tacky, fully absorbs quickly, NO added fragrance, no scent text: I have Rosacea, specifically type 1 where I experience redness from flushing and visible veins (telangiectasias). Otherwise clear skin. While topicals won't really help the veins, I can use products that help even out skin tone where it is pink from flushing. Some products can initially make my skin red, then it calms down (especially if new). This ISNTREE Cica Relief Ampoule Duo Set has not irritated my skin. In fact, it has helped to minimize aggravated skin.

The serum is extremely light. I think the lightest weight product I have ever used. The bottles are small, and I feel like I am going through it quickly. I may be using too much, I dont know. I do apply to neck and chest as well as face. I already use a product with EGF (epidermal growth factor), and I thought that maybe in serum form it would feel like a more concentrated dose. I have no idea how much Isntree uses, but this product feels like the emphasis is on the Centella Asiatica Extract. That isn't necessarily a bad thing, I am just not sure yet what I think about the performance of this product for my skin. The two small bottles would be better as 1 bottle.

--super light weight
--absorbs instantly
--not tacky
--skin feels instantly smooth (I also use some on the back of my hands)
--I wouldn't use it alone as a moisturizer, especially if have dry skin (like me)
--gentle, doesn't aggravate my skin, but that very well could differ for everyone (esp those w/ damaged skin barrier)
--contains soothing centella asiatica extract
--contains EGF- worth doing some research to see the benefits and to discount myths.
--ingredients that can help build and maintain skin barrier. Especially important for those with skin conditions where they are exacerbated by a damaged skin barrier. Got super sensitive skin? work on repairing that skin barrier before anything else.
--NO added fragrance in ingredient list. No naturally occurring scent either. I cant detect any aroma.

My skin: mid 40s, smooth and clear (except for visible veins), leans dry. I follow this up with a moisturizing SPF (their sunscreens are great) or a moisturizer if using at night.

I dont think it is bad. I really just think it is ok. I would give it 3.5 stars if I could. For me it isn't quite a 4 star product, so I am going with the middle of the road rating of 3. Your experience will vary. I think it would be especially appealing to those who prefer a weightless non tacky Centella Asiatica product. While I have zero issues with this, I am not likely to repurchase it. I have preferred products, especially for EGFs. However, if I notice anything else-- good or bad, I will be sure to update. It can take at least 2 weeks for a product to show its effectiveness, and it can take that long for the skin to acclimate to a new product. I am a little early on writing this, but my skin is used to centella asiatica as well as EGFs, and with some Isntree products.

title: They Work Great text: These perform very well. I use them to make my own essential oil (EO) bug sprays, after sun sprays, room refreshers, etc. They are small, spray well & don't leak.

The small size is great for portability. I take one of my bug spray formulas outside with me for while I work on my farm. Because I only use EO's the effectiveness wears off much faster than synthetic products. I keep the bottle on me to respray as needed. I have a bottle in my purse with a germ fighting blend for when stores are out of the cart wipes. I even made up a bottle of toilet spray. I use peppermint EO for that.

The funnel has a very narrow spout making pouring a slow processes but it keeps me from accidentally over filling the bottles. The tube that goes into the bottle is plenty long. It actually curls up in a C on the very bottom of the bottle. You can cut it if you want, but I leave it as is, I think they function better with the long tube. The stickers are a bit of a joke. I can't really fit "Bug Spray" on one tiny label. I'd have to write "BS" so I write "Bug" instead or "Sun" for example. It just barely fits.

Overall, great little spray bottles that suit my farm girl needs.

text: I'm really on a kick of trying the whole OZ line...and I am in love with all of it. In fact, I find a way to use every serum over two days. I use Retin A every other night and use the vitamin c serum after using it. The next night, I use the Vitamin c with AHA and the Hyaluronic acid serums along with this one. I do wait about 10-15 minuites between each. But, I use the eye gel every night. They all work so well together and my skin is looking and feeling so much better. My biggest problems are large pores and uneven texture. My texture has evened out so much and my pores are surprising me more each day. I'd say these serums really have made the biggest difference in my pores. I kept seeing my grandmother's nose in the mirror, and I'm only 46--I was really self conscious. I'm starting to like looking in the mirror now...I'm seeing pretty quick changes and I like them.

title: Very thin lotion with an unpleasant initial fragrance text: I love trying different lotions, particularly those that have nice fragrance, but when I received this set, I almost threw it away! I the bottle, the smell of the lotion is horrible - I found it to have a strong, artificial scent similar to alcoholic spirits. I decided to give it a try so that I could write an accurate review. The "lotion" is quite thin, much more watery than any other moisturizer I have used. Just to spread on my elbows requires at least 10 pumps from the tiny bottle. The good news is that once on the skin, the distasteful fragrance does not last; I didn't really detect much scent at all after that, but there may have been a faint hint of rose in the dry-down. The moisturization was adequate, nothing more.

I do like the Nail & Cuticle Oil, which comes in a little roller bottle and actually DOES have a rose scent. But this set is absolutely NOT worth the cost, especially given that the lotion is likely to be completely gone after just a few weeks of daily use. Not recommended.

NOTE: At least one other reviewer ("Jam Blaster") mentioned the same issue with the lotion smelling bad and gave this product just 1-star as a result.

UPDATE, 2/1/21:
Since I don't like the scent of this product, I decided to try it on my feet. Despite the lotion being very thin, I actually found it to work quite well on my feet! I put it on in the a.m., then put on socks; by the end of the day, my feet definitely felt soften and smoother. I think the product is too expensive to purchase for this reason alone, but it does work, and so I increased my rating to 3-star.

title: lightweight, natural coverage, dewy, has goodly amount of sunscreen text: #21 light neutral beige, and it is a pretty good match to my fair, cool skin.

My skin: fair, dry, mid 40s, pink cheeks from Rosacea (visible veins, zero acne). I find that this has light natural coverage using a foundation brush. It tones down my redness with ease. It can be built up, especially if allowed to semi dry between applications. I really like that it has SPF (PA++++) 50. I always use sunscreen, so adding this on top of my sunscreen base is just added protection. Also perfect for reapplication & touch ups through day.

I also find that it is hydrating on my dry skin. Has a dewy finish. My natural skin comes through but looks better- more spruced up and put together looking. I do notice that the finish depends on what I use before hand. When I have used this on bare skin, it has a more mattifying appearance. When I use on top of my moisturizer and/or moisturizing sunscreen, then it has a more dewy radiant look. I prefer the latter.

Seems to stay in place. I applied some to my forearm, and it is still in place a couple hours later. I have taken my finger to try to wipe it off, and it is still there.

4 stars. I prefer it for light coverage. When it is built up, it seems to take on a grayish cast on me.

title: Outstanding!! Smells Good! text: This is probably one of the best, if not, THE BEST conditioner I've ever used in my life.
It made my hair FEEL like no other conditioner has ever made my hair feel. Ever! This stuff is made in Germany, for whatever that's worth. My conditioner came in a nice box with NO insert. So don't expect to get any "promo" info or instructions. The box has 5 words: "rinse after 5-10 minutes." I left the product in my hair for 20 minutes 'cause I didn't SEE the instructions until later (in tiny print).
Just use it and see and FEEL the difference in your hair. You will NOT NEED a detangler either. Hair comes out smooth as silk.
Good stuff!

title: None drying face masks that smells amazing text: I have a few products by Higher Education and like the majority of them. This clay mask is fantastic. It comes in a squeeze tube which makes it easy to dispense how much of it you need. They tell you to apply it liberally to your clean skin. When you do that you will notice that fantastic fragrance this has which is great since you will have this on your face for 15 to 20 minutes or so.

During that time it will dry out and harden. Once the time is up rinse it warm water. I prefer to do these masks before I go into the shower so I can just rinse them when I am in the shower, so much easier and less of a mess if you ask me.

Once you are done you will notice that your skin eels actually nice and soft. A lot of these clay masks tend to dry up your skin but I was impressed that this one did not. It actually felt almost moisturized but I still followed it up with a nice moisturizer right after I was done like I always do.

I have to say this clay mask is great. It smells fantastic, is nice and gentle and does not dry you out. There are not a lot of clay masks out there that I do like because most dry my skin out but this one is fantastic.

title: Puts A Layer Of Silky Smoothness Between You & Your Make-Up text: N3 No Name Necessary Pore-Minimizing Mattifying Oil and Shine Control Anti-aging Makeup Face Primer Spray (200ml) puts a layer of silky smoothness between your skin and your make-up. I have combination skin- some parts dry, regular and oily. I also have aging skin, so I really didn‚Äôt think this primer spray would help me, but it surprisingly did. This comes in a spray bottle and you have to shake the bottle well before spraying, keeping your eyes tightly shut.

It sprays with a fine mist, but has a foaming in it. After spraying, I gently rubbed it more evenly on my face. It dries instantly and wow, my face felt like velvet. If anyone knows about aging skin- your make-up shows the fine lines and wrinkles more exaggerated. This primer spray somehow smooths your skin more, leaving it like a smooth slate for make-up. I am very impressed with this spray, as nothing helps aging skin like this does for make-up, powder, even touch up concealers. A wonderful product. 5 STARS.

title: Excellent disposable wax treatment text: This is an excellent portable paraffin wax treatment. I really love how it makes my hands feel really silky and smooth. I can't really do anything when these are on my hands, but they feel nice and I like relaxing with them. Also, the black heart on the outside actually turns red when the wax gets really hot. I used mine in the microwave, and it worked really well.

They have a unique design, which is basically a plastic hand wrapper that has a spongy interior, and the sponge holds all of the paraffin wax so that it delivers it right to your hands. It also stays hot for a pretty long time, which surprised me that all the heat didn't dissipate really quickly.

These are made for average hands, so if your hands are giant, then these might be hard to fit into. But, they should work pretty well for most hands. Also, they're great for the first treatment, but for subsequent treatments, it's really tough to keep the wax in the sleeve while microwaving.

But, overall, they're awesome for disposable paraffin treatments.

Pros:
+Makes your hands feel silky smooth
+The spongy interior absorbs and holds most of the wax
+The heat indicator really works

Cons:
-May not last a full five treatments

*TGN gave me this wax to review*

title: Patches Work Well...Not a Huge Fan of the Roller text: Somehow, I managed to dodge dark circles under my eyes for most of my life...until a few years ago. Now, they're the 'norm' for me. Same for puffy eyes. FRLEDM's 24K gold under eyes patches help tackle both issues and do so quickly. I keep the patches in the fridge-I get better results when they're cold and it feels good as well. I wear the patches in the morning for about 15 minutes and I'm good to go. It did take multiple uses before the results were obvious but that's to be expected. I like many of the ingredients in the patches, including: collagen, hyaluronic acid (HUGE fan!), and aloe, to name a few. I'm not a fan of the roller, unfortunately. I just do not care for the way it feels on skin...its not smooth and gentle, more like tugging and pulling. I will be passing it along to my mom who is anxious to try it.

While I'm not a fan of the roller, I am a fan of the patches and am pleased with the results they provide. I will continue to use the patches and definitely recommend them. I hate to say that I don't recommend the roller just because I don't like the way it feels so I will just say its not for me.

title: Calms Stressed, Sensitive Skin text: When skin is stressed, every little thing bothers it. Too much heat, too much cold, too much wind, too much dry air.
Those of us with sensitive skin know exactly what stressed out skin is. We need something that will soothe, without any irritation.
This particular cream hit that goal for me. I used it during a rosacea flare up, to help the redness and discomfort calm down. It worked very well. Not a miracle, but it worked well.
If you have skin like mine, I hope it works for you.

title: Good quality exfoliant text: The only reason I put 4 instead of 5 stars is it advertises all natural. Anything with that much brightness usually has added coloring and the ingredients lists a bunch of fancy things we can't understand which are basically manmade oils. It does exfoliate but it is not a hydrating exfoliant with its main feature being it is mostly of a salt consistency. And salt is meant to dry out. If you're looking for an exfoliant to help with ingrown hairs, brighten skin and get out dirt it is a good product. Exfoliant is also great for healed tattoos to keep that new brightness.
The smell is great, the consistency of the sand is good quality, and the packaging is very hygiene conscious and comes with multiple sealants so you know no one has opened your product.

title: This is THE molecule for you!
text: I bought Molecule 2 first, after watching a YouTube video about boosting fragrances that don't project well.  That one, to me, smelled like cotton candy.  Since these won't break the bank I decided to order Molecule 1 and Holy Moly!  I love that it is a pure molecule - you know how fragrances these days smell very complex?  Well, this is a simple, basic note that to me smells metallic and musky, in a VERY good way!  My nose picks it up very well and it is gorgeous - I will layer my weaker YSL fragrances with it but I will also wear it alone because I like it that much!  To me it is definitely a masculine scent, and I agree w/ others - it probably depends on your skin chemistry with this, which to me is a unique bonus - because that makes it a different scent on every person.  Since this takes 3 weeks to arrive and the bottle is not that big, I will be buying another very soon!  Highly recommend :)

title: Purchased this item in Marshall's for $6.99
text: So as I have stated in previous skin care  product reviews, I am EXTREMELY vain. That is probably due to the fact that I suffer with Adult Acne. Never had acne until I reached my mid 20's. So as a fair skin woman in her mid 30's my focus is to lessen the severity of my outbreaks, and to keep my skin looking youthful and CLEAR! Like other women in my predicament I have spend loads of money on what seems like millions of products sometimes they work, then after a couple of months they cease to have any effect. So besides incorporating multivitamins into my life (B complex, Flaxseed oil, MSM, DMAE, etc) which I take pretty consistently, I drink plenty of water or as much as I can take, eat fairly healthy (no soda, no juice, no candy, no chips, little to no fast food) and of course I exercise. All these things will play into how healthy your skin will and can be! So on a recent trip to South Carolina, I ran into a Marshall's and I always check out the skincare section. Now within the last couple of months my skin will begin to clear up completely then BAM I will get a medium red nodule, or inflamed whitehead.... UGH! And though you are not suppose too I always pop mine to relieve the pain and pressure. I always do it with clean hands, and typical wash my face with my 10% sulfur soap I purchased here on Amazon. So when I ran into this Brightening product for $6.99 it caught my eye. With all the sulfur and scrubs and acne drying products my skin was looking pretty dull and kinda flaky. I needed something to help diminish my acne scars, moisturize and smooth out my skin... and the fact that this product claimed to help with anti aging was the icing on the cake... so I took it home and gave it a whirl.... its been about 2 1/2 weeks I have used this product 2x a day each day as it is not heavy and provides the extra moisture I need. I have noticed significant difference in the color and size of my scars. my skin feels smooth and soft. I feel good about this product sofar I have had no adverse reactions to this serum. With any product it takes a keen eye and diligence to becoming successful in your skincare goals. I will see how I feel about this product once I finish the bottle. If this product continues to show me positive gradual results I might purchase another product as this is cheap and effective. As we head into a new year I am looking to go more organic in my skincare products and spend alil less than I have this year and previous years.

title: All natural Luxury text: I have never used a bath bomb, mostly I have used bath salts and made my own bath treatments, but had heard so much about bath bombs that I wanted to try them out for myself. I use essential oils so this one looked especially good to me. There are no funky ingredients or chemicals in it, so that was a huge plus for me. Each of the bath bombs has a name and what it is for. My favorite right off the bat was the grapefruit for energy. I was having a tired day and needed a pick me up, so I took a hot bath with one.

The bath bomb took a while to dissolve, so it lasted quite a while, then the water turned lightly colored. It was nice to feel on my toes as it dissolved. The smell was lovely, however it didn't last too long. On the next one I used I just dropped a few drops of essential oils that matched the scent, so it helped it stay scented longer.

All in all it is a lovely luxury to pamper yourself or give as a gift.

*I RECEIVED THIS PRODUCT (IN ORDER TO TRY IT AND REVIEW) THIS DOES NOT GUARANTEE A GOOD REVIEW OR CHANGE MY OPINION ON THE PRODUCT, I AM HONEST AND UNBIASED, ALL OPINIONS ON IT ARE MY OWN AND BASED ON THE PRODUCT ITSELF. I HAVE TRIED THIS AND EVALUATED IT ACCORDINGLY

title: Love these paper sheet masks, but pricier than others text: These are pricier than other compressed facial masks, but they have the advantage of prime shipping (as opposed to 2-3 weeks for international shipping) and of being individually wrapped. I wanted to try making my own masks asap, and also want to take these when I travel and to throw in beauty gifts (spa in a jar) for friends and family. So the fast shipping and individually wrapped masks were worth paying more for me.

I love the concept of soaking these in whatever you like, or placing over a mud mask so that my skin can soak up the benefits and detoxify without drying out too fast. However, these are a bit too small for me width-wise and definitely too small for my hubby (who is willing to sheet mask with me!). I'll probably buy these again just because I can easily travel with them and use in gifts, but I am going to look for larger ones that I can use on a more regular basis. And once you see the difference sheet masking can do for your skin, you might just look forward to using these as often as you can! I know I do!

(I found a really good recipe to brighten and moisturize the face: one egg white, teaspoon of honey, and the juice of a lemon/lime slice. Whisk it together, or shake in a jar, and dab all over your face. Then soak your mask in it and place on your face. It feels sooo good! And is cheap :)

title: Performance Just Like the Dentist Office BUT for ~ $140 on Sale now
text: We tried several home teeth whitening kits and most gave marginal results.  But this kit, performs just the same as what you get at the Dentist.  Look at the picture I posted.  Its the teeth color card. Out of 1 - 20, my wife started with 14 top and 11 bottom. She drank a lot of coffee, red wine, etc...We tried this kit and got her down to 4 top and 2 bottom. Her teeth are just as white as the dentist office whitening service.  Here is what separates this kit from others: 1) Performance is second to none, 2) You get most of the whitening results the first application which is 8 minutes.  Remember with this kit, you have to do 4 sets of 8 minutes per day.  Meaning a total of 32 minutes total per day.  Getting most of the whitening in the first 8 minutes is amazing results 3) It only takes 5 days and 2.5 vials total out of the 10 vials that comes with the kit.  Meaning she can maintain her whiteness for the next 4 months without spending more. The procedure costs ~$400 at the dentist. You pay ~$140 - $150 for this kit for the same fast results and can maintain it for 4 months, depending on your teeth.  Meaning out of all of the teeth whitening solutions available, this one ends up being the MOST COST EFFECTIVE with guaranteed results.  Meaning if your teeth were able to whiten before, you should get the same whitening again.  My teeth can't be whitened because how they developed before my permanent teeth came out. I had a high fever so my teeth are a little yellow as a result and can't be whitened much even at the dentist.  At any rate, this is the real thing and you keep the blue light system and battery pack.  Just buy more vials later when you run out.  Enjoy!

title: It's not what I thought it would be text: I gave this 3 stars for "Softness" because the brush is average to a bit firmer than what would be ideal and comfortable to use on your back, while the loofah strap is average. The brush bristles are kind of scratchy and not the "good exfoliating" kind of scratchy. They're more like the "ouch, that's scratching me" kind of scratchy. Overall, though, it's acceptable and average.

Next, I gave this 2 stars for "Easy to use" because I don't find this easy to use. The brush is separate from the stick that extends it to reach your back; you slide the oval-shaped brush onto the stick by inserting the stick into a cut out section on the back side brush. The problem here is that it doesn't stay on firmly at all. I ended up with 2 options: either not on firmly enough, so it kept popping off, or pushed on so much that it's very difficult to get off of the stick to use separately. The loofah strap is really easy to use, though. It's nice and long so there's plenty of length to comfortably hold each end and move it back and forth at most angles, no matter how thin or thick your arms or body may be. That's a real plus! But I still couldn't give more stars if only half of the set is easily usable.

Finally, I gave this 4 stars for sturdiness because there's no doubt, it seems pretty sturdy. The bristles on the brush have stayed intact. The loofah strap is firm and sewn solidly -- but it may be too firm. It's hard to get flexibility out of it. The elastic strap handle on the brush is flimsy, but overall, it's a solid set. The wood is a good, solid, well-finished wood without splits or cracks. It doesn't seem like a cheap product that's going to warp and break easily if you keep it away from hanging to be soaked when it's not needed for use. Putting it somewhere nearby where it stays dry is best.

title: Long lasting text: These khaki brown neutral shadows are a good addition to my makeup palette. My favorite feature of this 6 piece cream eye shadow is that it stays put even when I am sweating. Instead of streaking down my cheeks or blotching in the creases of my eyelids, it really stays on where it is supposed to, especially if I use an eyeshadow primer. The colors are lovely, neutral hues that most people will find complementary to their skin tone. I have a couple of their eye shadow sets, but this is the one that gets used the most.

The pink set is softly feminine with lighter colors to accent daywear. They are perfect for cooler skin tones or as highlights on the eye for warmer tones.

title: Excellent product, did Not contribute to cystic acne either. text: I will spare Nothing for beauty products and I've tried them all and in all price ranges, this beats them all so far. The suprising part is it's also replaced all eye creams I used to use. I put some on a Q tip and dab it around my eyes at night and the skin under my eyes is totally smooth and stays that way all day even under makeup. I'm 58 and as I say, I spare nothing to look my best including a great plastic surgeon so with that kind of money invested in my face I'm not going to skimp on moisturizer. The tube is designed so that cream Never backs up into the tube meaning the moisturizer is Always sterile, great if you've had a procedure or delicate skin. I do a home chemical peel every two weeks on my face, neck and chest every two weeks (ex sun worshiper) and this is the kind of cream that's perfect for the delicate after care of my skin. I also used it after having my whole face lasered at my plastic surgeons office too. I can't say enough about this and it was in all my Christmas stockings for my friends, male and female.
Oh, my skin is normal and not overly dry and even at my age I can break out with cystic acne, this did Not contribute to any break outs.

title: Good product
text: I took a risk by buying this since it didnt many reviews, but overall, I've had a good experience with it. Starting off with the packaging, it is well made, and it does bring many sheet masks you can pick up with some tweezers it brings. The masks in themselves are moist but not overly wet. That is, they will stick to your face (I've had these while walking around), but won't have product dripping down your neck. The solution is scented but not overly, and is not slimy as most masks, but will definitely tone/tighten your skin. I use these for 10min and they will remain there for that amount of time, but the edges will start to peel off after about 5 to 7min. I use these every other day. I would recommend these if you wanted to get the most masks out of your money, but honestly, I think there are better masks out there. That said, I will continue to use these.

title: Foot Peel Mask text: I finally got around to using this. I'm not sure why I was so scared of it. Although, anything that's supposed to take the skin off your body should probably cause some trepidation. That being said, test a little on your skin ahead of time to make sure you're not allergic, it's just good practice with new products.

When using, it works exactly as intended and as described. You follow the directions, put them on as instructed, and let them sit awhile. Then, you wash your feet off and do your thing for a few days. After that, you will gross yourself out with your nasty feet as the skin falls off in large, small, etc. pieces. It takes a few days, but at the end it got most of my callouses off and my feet did feel smoother. Now to just keep working at it.

Review by M. Reynard 2021
